body_html:
I assume you are expecting to get [5,None] from the inference.
In numpy style, if the slice range exceeds the original shape, it is clamped to the largest size possible.
This means that for tensors shaped 0, 1, 2, 3, 4 you will get tensors that are 0xNone, 1xNone, 2xNone, 3xNone, 4xNone. Only if the the placeholder is 5x10 or larger will you see a fixed value of 5.

body:
I assume you are expecting to get [5,None] from the inference.
In numpy style, if the slice range exceeds the original shape, it is clamped to the largest size possible.
This means that for tensors shaped 0, 1, 2, 3, 4 you will get tensors that are 0xNone, 1xNone, 2xNone, 3xNone, 4xNone. Only if the the placeholder is 5x10 or larger will you see a fixed value of 5.
